Key Match Events: Greece broke the deadlock through Anastasios Bakasetas three minutes into the second half
Caoimhin Kelleher made a big error while trying to pass out from the back in the dying moments of the game, gifting Greece their second of the match as Petros Mantalos made sure of the three points
Pre-Game Insights: Greece are in stellar form following their shock 2-1 win over England at Wembley Stadium on Thursday
Post-Match Reflections: The Republic of Ireland stay in third place - a relegation qualification spot - with two games left to play, while England occupy the promotion qualification spot in second
Miscellaneous Highlights: Erling Haaland could not score in a third-successive match for Norway, who were heavily beaten by Austria
Greece are top of Group B2 despite the Three Lions' win in Finland
Others: The Republic of Ireland face Finland in Dublin next before making the short trip to Wembley Stadium for a rematch against England
